Name: advent-calendar-tile-format
Title: Advent Calendar Tile Format
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates an advent calendar where you can click on the present box of the day to see the presents.

Name: alternating-rowclass
Title: Alternating Rows
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Highlights every other row using theme colors.

Name: average-rating-rowclass
Title: Average Rating Row Class
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to change the background color of a row based on Average Rating.

Name: birthday-format
Title: Birthday Row Format
Author: April Dunham
Description: This is a sample derived from the [contact card row format](../contact-card-format). It shows how to format a list to show upcoming employee birthdays. It features the following:

Name: board-tag-format
Title: Board tag format
Author: Andr√© Lage
Description: Display Customized formatted card in board with multiple customizations

Name: budget-tracker
Title: Budget Tracker Sample
Author: Todd Baginski
Description: The budget tracker sample demonstrates how to use view formatting to format lists and display views of the lists inside connected web parts. This provides the ability to view the budget items associated with individual projects on a single page.

Name: bulletin-board-format
Title: Bulletin Board
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Provides an example of creating a simple bulletin board listing. The `rowFormatter` property is used to fully customize the display of rows to create a nice view of list items while easily allowing users to click on the item for additional details (see animation below). The large size and use of icons makes this much more attractive than a simple table view and keeps the functionality simple for users.

Name: butterfly-chart-format
Title: Butterfly Chart Format
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample formats a SharePoint list view into a butterfly chart.

Name: choice-conditional-format
Title: Conditional formatting based on a Choice field
Author: Eric Skaggs

Name: chronological-format
Title: Chronological Format
Author: Franck Catinot
Description: This sample formats your view to look like a chronological timeline.

Name: commandbar-hide-automate
Title: Hide Automate Button in the CommandBar
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Hides the Automate button when an item or items are selected.

Name: contact-card-format
Title: Contact Card Row Format
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This is a sample of a complex format that customizes the entire display of a row. The goal is to illustrate several key principals including:

Name: content-navigator
Title: Content Navigator
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Demonstrates the use of the id attribute to create linkable anchors.

Name: contenttype-format
Title: ContentType Format
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Provides an example of customizing your format based on the item's content type. When an item's ContentType is Apple and the apple type is "Green" then green is used in the format. It it's Apple with a different type, red is used. Otherwise, orange is used.

Name: currentuser-liked-rowclass
Title: Currentuser Liked Row Class
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to change the background color of a row that has been liked by the current user.

Name: current-year-rowclass
Title: Current Year Row Class
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Demonstrates applying a class to rows where a value equals the current year. Can easily be updated to compare other portions of the date such as the month, hour, minute etc. by using the other date-part operators.

Name: custom-header-format
Title: Custom Header
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Sometimes it is necessary to remove the standard headers. In those cases, you may still want to show a custom header. This sample demonstrates creating a custom header and only showing it on the first row. The key to this technique is setting the `display` style attribute to `none` (hidden) whenever the `@rowIndex` is not 0 (first row).

Name: custom-hover-cards
Title: Custom hover card on List view
Author: Niket Jain
Description: The following image shows a list with a custom hover added to a List view:

Name: default-hover-cards
Title: Default hover card on doclib
Author: Niket Jain
Description: The following image shows a list with a defalut hover added to a formatted view in a doclib

Name: disable-selection
Title: Disable Selection
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This is a very basic sample that disables list item selection within your view.

Name: document-library-thumbnails
Title: Document Library Items in Tiles Format
Author: Ravi Chandra
Description: This sample uses rowFormatter element to overrides the default formatting on the All Documents view.  The view uses thumbnail property to display the items in tiles view with custom size.

Name: elf-progress-board
Title: Elf Progress Board
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Demonstrates multi-level progress bars, randomization, handling image fields, setValue actions, and inlineEditField

Name: emoji-link-tile-format
Title: Link collection using Emoji
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates a link collection using Emoji and is a customization of the `Gallery` layout. Additionally, this sample combines group customization with a tile format.

Name: employee-onboarding-steps
Title: Employee Onboarding: Steps
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample is intended to be used in combination with the Employee Onboarding list template. The format restores the intended alternating rows but also adds a Tiles view that provides a more step based approach.

Name: events-format
Title: Events Format
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates applying view formatting to an Events list to imitate the modern events webpart. The format is implemented using the Tiles view and there is a format included that only includes this portion to make customization easier ([events-format-tiles-only](./events-format-tiles-only.json)). The primary sample demonstrates using a single format to provide both a list and tile view as well as demonstrating implementing a custom hover card with default person hover cards as well.

Name: faq-format
Title: Faq-Format
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This is sample creates an FAQ formatted list. Optionally, you can include the Keyword and KeywordLink columns for the [faq-keyword-links-format.json](./faq-keyword-links-format.json) sample.

Name: faq-grouped
Title: Grouped FAQs
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample uses standard group rendering to provide a list of expandable questions.

Name: generic-numeric-average-comparison
Title: Numeric Average Comparison
Author: David Warner II
Description: Provides an example of comparing numeric values across time periods. In this example, we are using grades for students across 4 quarters, though the principle can be applied to any repetitive numeric values.

Name: generic-risk-score-format
Title: Project Indicator - Risk Score Indicator
Author: S Merchant
Description: A number column is evaluated against tiers of values to provide colors corresponding to score ranges.

Name: generic-ryg-status-format
Title: Project Indicator - RYG Status Format
Author: S Merchant
Description: Text or choice column where the value is used to determine the color. This allows for an easy visualization of status. To use a lookup column instead, replace all occurences of [$internalfieldname] with  [$internalfieldname.lookupValue].

Name: generic-tile-format
Title: Items in Tile Layout
Author: S Merchant
Description: This sample uses tileProps element to create tile layout on the view.  This layout allow users to see the list as the promoted links app (including the power the security trimming on the items).  This sample uses the Icons from the Microsoft UI Fabric. The name of the icon is referenced through an Icon field.

Name: generic-video-button
Title: generic-video-button
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Demonstrates the use of dynamic connections in the list webpart while using a custom format. This results in a custom video selection application that changes the embeded video on the page.

Name: get-video-file-embed-code
Title: View to get the embed code for a video file
Author: Marc Mroz
Description: If you upload video files to a SharePoint document library, there currently isn't a way for an end user to easily get the iFrame embed code for the video file other than using the [Microsoft Graph Preview item API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/driveitem-preview). This document library view formatting example composes the iFrame embed code automatically for any video files in the library so users could easily copy and paste it.

Name: group-header-user-picture
Title: Display user's picture in group header
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This is a sample of customizing the group header when grouping by user column. Display the user's picture as well as the user's name in the group header.

Name: heat-map
Title: Heat Map
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates creating a layered dynamic SVG image in a view format.

Name: heat-map
Title: Heat Map
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates creating a layered dynamic SVG image in a view format.

Name: honeycomb-link
Title: Honeycomb Links
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: Formats links to look like honeycombs!

Name: image-slider-format
Title: Image Slider format
Author: Andr√© Lage
Description: This sample includes format to display images in Lists as slider moving to next clicking the icon on top left of image.

Name: in-memoriam-tileProps-format
Title: in-memoriam-tileProps-format
Author: Chris Kent
Description: in-memoriam-tileProps-format

Name: issue-tracker-planner-cards
Title: Issue Tracker: Planner Cards
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample is intended to be used in combination with the Issue Tracker list template. The format keeps the row highlighting for blocked issues but also adds a Tiles view that provides a Microsoft Planner look and feel.

Name: likes-count-rowclass
Title: Likes Count Row Class
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to change the background color of a row depending on the number of likes.

Name: london-tube-status
Title: London Underground Line Status
Author: Leon Armston
Description: Display on the homepage of your SharePoint intranet a continually updated feed of London Underground line statuses using the publicly available Transport for London (TFL) API.

Name: menu-tiles-format
Title: Menu Tiles format
Author: Andr√© Lage
Description: This sample includes the Metro tiles style menu with ability to change the format and order of the tiles.

Name: message-chat-format
Title: Message Chat Format
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample formats your SharePoint list view to look like a message chat. If `Author` equals `@me`, the message will be displayed on the right.

Name: multi-choice-link-format
Title: Multi choice link row format
Author: Anoop Tatti
Description: Demonstrates using a multi-choice column to create multiple links

Name: multi-person-currentuser-rowclass
Title: Current User's Rows (Using a Multi-Person Column)
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Highlights the entire row for any list items where one of the assigned to users is the current user (the user viewing the list view, not the author of the format). You can easily adjust this to use a different person column by changing the `[$AssignedTo]` portion of the expression.

Name: multi-person-format
Title: Multiple person format
Author: Andr√© Lage
Description: This sample provider different formats on how multiple person selection can be display.

Name: out-of-office-format
Title: Out of office row format
Author: Tom Resing
Description: This is a sample derived from the [birthday row format](../birthday-format). It shows how to format a list to show upcoming employee time away from office. It features the following:

Name: person-currentuser-rowclass
Title: Current User's Rows
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Highlights the entire row for any list items assigned to the current user (the user viewing the list view, not the author of the format). You can easily adjust this to use a different column like Author or Editor by changing the `[$AssignedTo]` portion of the expression.

Name: piano-format
Title: Piano Format
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample formats your SharePoint list view to look like a piano.

Name: planner-inspired-task-card
Title: Planner Inspired Task Cards
Author: April Dunham
Description: Formats Task List Items in a Planner Inspired Card View. Uses OfficeUIFabric Icons to designate "In Progress", "Completed" and "Delayed" Statuses. Automatically strikes out text for "Completed" items.

Name: product-catalog
Title: Product Catalog Sample
Author: Todd Baginski
Description: The product catalog sample demonstrates how to use view formatting to format lists and display views of the lists inside web parts. It also demonstrates how to create links to download documents from the SharePoint Document libraries.

Name: profile-card
Title: User Profile Card
Author: Ejaz Hussain
Description: This is simple user profile card built to provide a tile view with contact buttons. A default image is shown if a picture is not provided.

Name: project-gantt-chart
Title: Project Gantt Chart View
Author: Geert de Kooter
Description: This project Gantt Chart sample demonstrates how to show a list of high level tasks in a Gantt chart. It is mainly useful for top-level views.

Name: project-health-dashboard
Title: Project Health Dashboard
Author: Andres Ibarra
Description: This is a template for Project health statuses; it has nice features such as Risk scoring, Severity of the project, Schedule timing, Hover effects that provide the latest project updates, Theme Colors, Project Team members, and the cost of the project.

Name: random-item
Title: Random Item
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates utilizing layering to draw all rows on top of each other and then the z-index is set to a randomized value to determine which row to draw on the very top.

Name: recent-comments
Title: Recent Comments
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample shows text from the most recent items by showing them in decresing sizes as they get older.

Name: rota-css-table
Title: Staff Rota Shifts View Format
Author: Ariel Kropp
Description: This is a sample that uses `rowFormatter` to customise the entire display of a row. The aim is to demonstrate the following concepts:

Name: search-tag-format
Title: Search Tag format
Author: Andr√© Lage
Description: This sample includes format to allow search word in field and allow to include tags in Choice field.

Name: stat-comparison-chart

Author: Anoop Tatti
Description: Format a list view into a chart that shows a comparison between two entities against various attributes

Name: sticky-notes-board-format

Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to display sticky notes in Board View.

Name: teams-group-format
Title: teams group format
Author: Andr√© Lage
Description: This sample uses Microsoft Teams deep links to create Teams chat group based on selected users with associated Group name and message.

Name: testimonials
Title: Testimonials
Author: Andres Ibarra
Description: This is a template for testimonials (Business Statements), it has nice features such as directional messages, styles, utilizes the current theme colors, image persona hover card, overflow logic and even has some SVG Magic! üôå

Name: text-conditional-format
Title: Conditional formatting based on choice field
Author: Lincoln DeMaris

Name: tictactoe-format
Title: tic tac toe format
Author: Andr√© Lage
Description: This sample recreate the tic tac toe game using SharePoint List formatting and new feature setValue.

Name: tile-layout-example-with-formatting
Title: Items in Tile Layout with images and Formatting for Doclib
Author: Niket Jain
Description: This sample uses tileProps element to format the tile layout  for document libraries.

Name: tile-layout-example-with-image
Title: Items in Tile Layout with images
Author: Rk Menon
Description: This sample uses tileProps element to format the tile layout of the view.

Name: timeline-board-format
Title: Timeline in Board View
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates displaying timelines in Board View.

Name: timeline-format
Title: Timeline Format
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample formats your SharePoint list view to look like a timeline.

Name: tree-format
Title: Tree format
Author: Andr√© Lage
Description: This sample includes format to add a tree style using column options.

Name: twitter-format
Title: Twitter Format
Author: April Dunham
Description: This sample formats your SharePoint list view to look like Twitter. If you are using the Microsoft Flow Templates to track tweets in a SharePoint list, this is a great way to format your list so that it looks more like Twitter. For more info on Flow Templates that take Tweets and add them to a SharePoint list check out this template: https://us.flow.microsoft.com/en-us/galleries/public/templates/e78571e5c70e4806a18eeacba5a897c8/save-tweets-that-include-a-specific-hashtag-to-a-sharepoint-list/

Name: wordle-game-tile-format
Title: Microsoft Lists Wordle Game
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample reproduces the popular word puzzle game Wordle with Microsoft Lists.

Name: blank-header
Title: blank-header
Author: Chris Kent
Description: By default, uncustomized list forms display the Title field at the top. This is generally fine, but sometimes you may not want this (especially since the default is to repeat it as the first column). This very basic format removes the default Title display giving you a cleaner form.

Name: dashed-line-header
Title: Dashed Line Header
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample displays the Title and Description values in the heading and decorates them with dashed lines. If the Description value is empty, it will be hidden.

Name: event-itinerary-header
Title: Event Itinerary Header
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample shows a customized header for the item form used in the "Event itinerary" list template.

Name: ribbon-header

Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates displaying a ribbon in the header.

Name: status-header-footer
Title: status-header-footer
Author: Chris Kent
Description: status-header-footer

Name: wave-header-footer
Title: Wave header and footer
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to display waves in the header and footer of a form. Waves are displayed using SVG.

Name: workflow-progress-header
Title: Workflow Progress Header
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample shows a checkmark for each date field that has a value to help convey when milestones have been hit.

Name: wrapped-body
Title: wrapped-body
Author: Chris Kent
Description: wrapped-body

Name: approval-buttons-setValue-status-user
Title: Inline Approval
Author: Michel Mendes
Description: Creates buttons to approve/reject an (item) by updating an Approval Status field created using a choice field, and also set the value of a person field to the user who took the action by using the setValue action.

Name: color-based-smiley-face
Title: Smiley faces for good quiz results
Author: Siddharth Vaghasia
Description: This sample is to display smiley faces based on color value, As for sample, it is based on color choice column value of

Name: comment-count
Title: comment-count
Author: Chris Kent
Description: comment-count

Name: currency-symbol-concatenation
Title: Concatenate Currency Symbol to Numeric Columns
Author: S Merchant
Description: This sample will allow the users to concatenate a currency symbol(¬£, $ ... etc.) to the existing data. This sample will compare two numeric columns and add a currrency symbol. In this example, two columns (Budget Approved and Expenditure To Date) from a Project Register has been used.

Name: custom-hover-card
Title: Custom hover card on Lists
Author: Niket Jain
Description: The following image shows a list with a custom hover added to a List:

Name: date-check-blank-format
Title: Formatting a column when a date column is blank
Author: Ganesh Sanap
Description: This example populates the text content and applies different classes to the Status field depending on the value inside an item's DueDate field. This example applies formatting to one field by looking at the value inside another field. Note that DueDate is referenced using the `[$FieldName]` syntax. FieldName is assumed to be the internal name of the field. This example also takes advantage of a special value that can be used in date/time fields - `@now`, which resolves to the current date/time, evaluated when the user loads the list view.

Name: date-compress-format
Title: Compressed Date
Author: Andr√© Lage
Description: This sample provide a different style to provide Date in a compress way such us align days and month and display year parallel as vertical.

Name: date-difference
Title: Date Difference
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates calculating the difference between 2 dates. In this sample the age in years is calculated based on the date of birth and the date of death. This format could easily be adjusted to calculate a different unit of time (months, days, hours, minutes, etc.) by adjusting the multiplier.

Name: date-monthly-emoji
Title: Monthly Emoji
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to display a emoji representing the month of the date to the left of the date.

Name: date-page-a-day-calendar
Title: Page-a-day Calendar
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample customizes a date column to look like a page-a-day calendar. It does this by using the date part functions (`getDate`, `getMonth`, and `getYear`).

Name: date-range-format
Title: Formatting an item when a date column is before or after today's date
Author: Vesa Juvonen
Description: This example colors the current field red when the value inside an item's DueDate is before the current date/time. Unlike some of the previous examples, this example applies formatting to one field by looking at the value inside another field. Note that DueDate is referenced using the [$FieldName] syntax. FieldName is assumed to be the internal name of the field. This example also takes advantage of a special value that can be used in date/time fields - `@now`, which resolves to the current date/time, evaluated when the user loads the list view.

Name: date-range-rag
Title: Creating Red-Amber-Green (RAG) bars based on date ranges
Author: Christopher Parker|Joe Ayre
Description: This example creates colored data bars on the current field based on `DueDate` and `StartDate` fields compared to the current date/time.

Name: date-update-format
Title: date update format
Author: Andr√© Lage
Description: Demonstrates updating a date value directly from the format.

Name: file-thumbnail
Title: File Thumbnails
Author: Chris Kent|Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: Utilizes the @thumbnail placeholder token to create an inline preview for document libraries.

Name: generic-approval-status-hover-card
Title: Approval Status Hover Card
Author: Django Lohn
Description: Adds a hover card with additional details when using Content Approval

Name: generic-centered-content
Title: Centered Content
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Demonstrates making your content be both vertically and horizontally centered (in the middle) within the cell.

Name: generic-column-chart
Title: Inline Column Chart
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates displaying a column chart using SVG. It uses the `currentColor` for the fill value of the SVGs which allows us to use a theme class to make the final SVGs fit your site's theme.

Name: generic-comment-count
Title: Display Comment Count
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample shows the comment count for a list item.

Name: generic-download-file-button
Title: Download File Button
Author: Ganesh Sanap
Description: This sample demonstrates adding a button within a document library view which downloads the file.

Name: generic-file-preview
Title: File Preview
Author: Geert de Kooter
Description: This sample opens Microsoft Office documents in full screen within a new tab. This is the same view as used in the fileviewer webpart (no toolbars).

Name: generic-flow-status
Title: generic-flow-status
Author: Chris Kent
Description: generic-flow-status

Name: generic-hyperlink-thumbnail
Title: Turn FileRef field into thumbnail image or clickable hyperlink
Author: Josef Lahmer
Description: This example uses a column to generate a hyperlink to the Item Thumbnail for a document library.

Name: generic-hyperlink-values
Title: Turn field values into hyperlinks
Author: Vesa Juvonen
Description: This example shows how to turn a text field that contains stock ticker symbols into a hyperlink that targets the Yahoo Finance real-time quotes page for that stock ticker. The example uses a `+` operator that appends the current field value to the static hyperlink http://finance.yahoo.com/quote/. You can extend this pattern to any scenario in which you want users to view contextual information related to an item, or you want to start a business process on the current item, as long as the information or process can be accessed via a hyperlink parameterized with values from the list item.

Name: generic-icon-overlay
Title: Icon Overlays
Author: Chris Kent
Description: You can UI Fabric Icons within your column and view formats. This sample demonstrates combining multiple icons by overlaying to create colorful icons that can indicate more information than a single icon can.

Name: generic-issuestatus-pill
Title: Issue Status Pill
Author: Hugo Bernier
Description: This format demonstrates how you can reproduce the status choices as pills found in the Microsoft Lists Issue Tracker template..

Name: generic-launch-powerapp
Title: Launch Power App Button
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Providing a direct link to an item within Power Apps is easy to do using this sample. To use it follow the instructions below to get the link to your Power App (and replace that portion of the format).

Name: generic-likedby
Title: Display users who have liked
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates showing the users who have liked an item.

Name: generic-like-unlike
Title: Like/Unlike List Item
Author: Ganesh Sanap
Description: Demonstrates how to like/unlike a list item.

Name: generic-mailto-button
Title: Mail To Button
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates making a mailto link (opens email with prepopulated values) button that references a different field.

Name: generic-project-management
Title: Project Indicator Formats
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Three related formats for use in project management.

Name: generic-right-align
Title: Centered Content
Author: Mike Honey
Description: This sample shows how to right-align your content, while preserving the number or date format set using the SharePoint / Lists UI.  Numbers and dates should typically be presented as right-aligned, for improved readability.

Name: generic-rowactions
Title: Row Actions
Author: Chris Kent
Description: You can use column and view formatting to create buttons that perform pre-defined actions when clicked. This sample provides a quick format that demonstrates the use of each of the possible actions.

Name: generic-rowIndex-drawing
Title: Row Index Drawing
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This is a silly format that draws a picture in your view using the @rowIndex token to adjust the colors and to determine when certain pictures (icons or SVG elements) should show up.

Name: generic-scheduling-link
Title: Linking to the scheduling dialog in Microsoft Teams and Microsoft Outlook
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates creating deep links to the scheduling dialog in Microsoft Teams and Microsoft Outlook.

Name: generic-socialpic
Title: Display Social Media Profile Pics Using Social Media Handles
Author: David Warner II
Description: Social media profile pictures are displayed in a circle and clicking them will open the user's social media page in a new window..

Name: generic-start-flow
Title: Create a button to launch a Flow for the selected item
Author: Yannick Borghmans
Description: You can use column formatting to create buttons that, when clicked, run Flows on the corresponding list item. The Flow Launch Panel will be displayed after clicking the button allowing the user to specify any required data and then run the flow.

Name: generic-start-flow-conditionally
Title: Create a button to conditionally launch a Flow for the selected item
Author: Chris Kent
Description: You can use column formatting to create buttons that, when clicked, run Flows on the corresponding list item. The Flow Launch Panel will be displayed after clicking the button allowing the user to specify any required data and then run the flow. This is demonstrated in the [Generic-Start-Flow](../generic-start-flow) sample.

Name: generic-staticmap
Title: Displays a customizable Google map image for a given location
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This template takes advantage of Google Maps' [staticmap API](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/static-maps/) which generates an image using a parameterized URL. The template only uses the most basic features ([location](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/static-maps/intro#Locations) & [image size](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/static-maps/intro#Imagesizes), but the API offers deep customization including:

Name: generic-substring-status
Title: Substring Status
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This format demonstrates using a combination of the substring and indexOf operations to 'split' a value and make style decisions based on portions of the value.

Name: generic-svgicon-format
Title: SVG icons
Author: Chris Kent
Description: The Fluent UI icons are easy to use in column formatting by simply specifying the name in the iconName attribute. However, the available selection of icons may not always meet your needs. Fortunately, you can use inline SVG elements with custom paths. This means you can use icons from sources like Font Awesome that provide SVG versions of their icons!

Name: generic-timeline
Title: Timeline Format
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates displaying a timeline in a column. If the column value is empty, no circle will be displayed. The content of the column will be shown in a popup when you click on the dot.

Name: generic-time-schedule
Title: Time Schedule
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates a time schedule with a filled background from Start time to End time.

Name: generic-twitterpic
Title: Display Twitter profile pics using Twitter handles
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Using just the Twitter handle, Twitter profile pictures are displayed in a circle and clicking them will open the user's Twitter page in a new window. The handle is also displayed as a tooltip when hovering over the profile image.

Name: generic-yearly-gantt-chart
Title: Yearly Gantt Chart
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates the display of a yearly Gantt chart.

Name: generic-youtube-thumbnail
Title: YouTube Thumbnail
Author: Jo√£o Ferreira
Description: This sample provides a thumbnail of a YouTube video that links to the video and a larger preview image on hover.

Name: hyperlink-click-count
Title: Count the number of clicks on a link
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates counting the number of clicks on a link.

Name: image-lightbox
Title: Image Lightbox
Author: Jo√£o Ferreira|Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates showing the full size image in a lightbox (hover card) rather than opening this image in a new window.

Name: location-address
Title: Display Location Address Details
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Location columns provide several properties that can be accessed to provide more information to users. This sample pulls out sub properties to turn the standard Display Name only to a full address and provides a link to Bing Maps for a given location.

Name: location-weather
Title: Display Location Weather Details
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample utilizes sub properties of a Location column to build an image that pulls weather from WeatherForYou.com

Name: managed-metadata-tag-icon
Title: Managed Metadata Tag Icon
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample displays a tag icon to the left of the value in the managed metadata column.

Name: multi-choice-foreach
Title: Multi-Choice forEach
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates usage of the forEach property to create template elements applied to each choice in a multi-select choice field.

Name: multi-choice-icons
Title: Multi-Choice Icons
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates using the indexOf and join functions (O365 only) to test if a multi-select choice field has a selected choice. Providing icons of the known choices and applying themed colors based on if the given choice is selected or not creates an intuitive, easy to understand visualization that doesn't suffer from varying item order or text formatting issues.

Name: multi-choice-links
Title: Multi choice Links
Author: Anoop Tatti
Description: This sample shows how we can display multiple links in a single column using the multi-choice column.

Name: multi-choice-workcategory-pill
Title: Work Progress Category Pill
Author: Ganesh Sanap
Description: This JSON sample demonstrates how you can format the work progress category choices as pills found in the newly released Microsoft Lists Work progress tracker template.

Name: multi-lookup-projected-field
Title: Multi-lookup fields and projected fields
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Lookup columns that support multiple values can be formatted using the advanced `forEach` property. Unfortunately, the way values are returned for any projected fields (additional columns associated to your lookup column) can present unique challenges. This sample provides two formats illustrating the difference in how these columns are formatted.

Name: multi-person-currentuser
Title: Highlight the current user
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample uses the @me keyword to check if the person field contains the current user and shows that entry using a different color and weight. This is a dynamic check that will always highlight the user using the list (not the creater of the format). This template could easily be extended to apply different/additional styles or icons as desired by simply copying the same expression logic for other fields.

Name: multi-person-facepile
Title: Multi-Person Facepile
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample provides rounded images for each person in a multi-select person field.

Name: multi-person-mailto
Title: Multi-Person Mail To Link
Author: Ganesh Sanap
Description: This column formatting sample demonstrates how to add a mailto: link for each person in a multiple selection person column.

Name: multi-person-reaction
Title: Reacting and displaying users who have reacted
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to react and display users who have reacted.

Name: multi-person-teams-chat-link
Title: Multi-Person Teams Chat Link
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates creating a deep link to a Microsoft Teams chat. This format works both within Microsoft Teams and within SharePoint Online.

Name: multi-person-unique-reaction
Title: Like / Dislike - Unique reaction
Author: Michel Mendes
Description: This sample provides rounded images for each person in a multi-select person field.

Name: number-abs-tolerance-comparison
Title: Determine Tolerance Comparison using abs()
Author: David Warner II
Description: Display if a value is within the expected tolerance.

Name: number-background-color-shading
Title: Background color shading by number column value
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to change the shade of the background color according to the value of the number column.

Name: number-battery
Title: Number Battery
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample changes the appearance of the values in number columns (percent)  to look like a battery.

Name: number-circle-in-circle
Title: Number Circle in Circle
Author: Geert de Kooter
Description: This sample shows how the percentage value in a column can be displayed as the area of a circle within another circle.

Name: number-conditional-format
Title: Conditional formatting based on a number range
Author: Vesa Juvonen
Description: This example uses the conditional operator ? to apply a class (sp-field-severity--warning) to the parent div element when the value in the current field is less than or equal to 70. This causes the field to be highlighted when the value is less than or equal to 70, and appear normally if it's greater than 70.

Name: number-conditional-progress-color
Title: Conditional Progress Color
Author: Ari Gunawan
Description: This sample demonstrates displaying progress bar with conditional color based on the value.

Name: number-countup-countdown
Title: Display count-up and count-down buttons
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates a button with a number increasing by one and a button with a number decreasing by one.

Name: number-data-bar
Title: Format a number column as a data bar
Author: Vesa Juvonen|Chris Kent
Description: These formats apply background-color and border-top styles to create a data bar visualization of @currentField, which is a number field. These styles are applied using the special column formatting class sp-field-dataBars. The bars are sized differently for different values based on the way the width attribute of the main div is set.

Name: number-data-bar-multi-color
Title: Multi-Colored Databars
Author: Ganesh Sanap
Description: This column formatting sample demonstrates how to show the number column as data bars with multiple colors.

Name: number-doughnut-chart
Title: Doughnut Chart
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: Changes the appearance of the values in number columns (percent) to a donut chart.

Name: number-emoji-progressbar
Title: Progress bar using text or emoji
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates the use of text symbols and emoji to display a progress bar.

Name: number-gauge
Title: Number Gauge
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates combining a fixed SVG (gauge background) with a dynamic SVG (needle). It makes understanding number columns (percent) very intuitive.

Name: number-heart-in-heart
Title: Heart in Heart
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to change the size of a heart by using the percent value of a numeric column.

Name: number-heart-shading
Title: Heart shading
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to express percentages in terms of the color shading of a heart displayed in SVG.

Name: number-icon-progressbar
Title: Icon Progress Bar
Author: Julien Seguin
Description: This sample demonstrates creating a progress bar using icons. The number column represents the stage in a process and the format provides a visual indicator of where an item is in relation to the process by showing the previous steps as completed, highlighting the current step, and indicating which steps remain.

Name: number-piechart
Title: Formatting percentage number (%) to pie chart.
Author: Aaron Miao|Chris Kent
Description: This example renders whole pie in neutralLight with radius 50 and the number% (column value) as a slice of the pie in blue using `<svg>` with `<path>` tags. The number% displayed at the bottom of the pie in neutralPrimary.

Name: number-quiz-smiley-face
Title: Smiley faces for good quiz results
Author: Matt Maher
Description: This allows teachers to show smiley faces next to quiz results similar to how they do it on paper. The number (based on a 0-100 score) will indicate if its a smiley or frown, which come from the Offie UI Fabric Icon set. If the number is above 90 the student gets a super smiley (`Emoji`), above 75 regular smile (`Emoji2`), above 60 neutral smiley (`EmojiNeutral`), below 60 a frown (`EmojiDisappointed`), and anything else gets an `Unknown`.

Name: number-trending-icon
Title: Show trending up/trending down icons
Author: Vesa Juvonen|David Warner II
Description: These formats rely on two number fields, Before and After, for which the values can be compared. They show the appropriate trending icon next to the value of the After field, depending on that field's value compared to the value in Before. The sp-field-trending--up class is used when After's value is higher; the sp-field-trending--down class is used when After's value is lower. No icon is shown when they are equal (padding is added to keep consistent alignment).

Name: number-version-publish-status
Title: Publishing Status
Author: Paul Bullock
Description: Sample contains an example of using the modulo math expression for highlighting 'published', 'published with draft' and 'draft with no published versions' of pages

Name: person-currentuser
Title: Highlight the current user
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample uses the @me keyword to check if the person field is the current user and shows that person using a different color and weight. This is a dynamic check that will always highlight the user using the list (not the creater of the format). This template could easily be extended to apply different/additional styles or icons as desired by simply copying the same expression logic for other fields.

Name: person-hover-card
Title: Person Hover Card
Author: Niket Jain
Description: The following image shows a list with a default hover added to a formatted column in a list

Name: person-mailto
Title: Person Mail To Link
Author: Vesa Juvonen
Description: You can use column formatting to render quick action links next to fields. This sample, intended for a person field, renders two elements inside the parent `<div />` element:

Name: person-roundimage-format
Title: Display a person's profile picture in a circle
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample applies styles to a parent div element and a child img element to show a person's profile picture in a circle.

Name: person-teams-call-format
Title: Teams Call Format
Author: Andr√© Lage
Description: This sample uses Microsoft Teams deep links to create links from selected user that allow to make Microsoft Teams calls to user.

Name: picture-roundimage-format
Title: Display a picture column as a circle
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample applies styles to a parent `div` element and a child `img` element to show a picture column in a circle.

Name: promotedstate-demote-news
Title: Demoting the news
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to use the setValue action to update the value of the Promoted State column to 0 and demote the news to a page.

Name: text-bing-map
Title: Displays a customizable Bing Map image for a given location in a Multi-Line of Text Field
Author: April Dunham
Description: This template uses Bing Maps staticmap API which generates an image using a parameterized URL. The template only uses the most basic features of map location and image size. To see all of the available option see the static map documentation

Name: text-conditional-format
Title: Conditional formatting based on the value in a text or choice field
Author: Lincoln DeMaris
Description: You can apply conditional formatting to text or choice fields that might contain a fixed set of values. The following example applies different classes depending on whether the value of the field is Done, In Review, Blocked, or another value. This example applies a CSS class (`sp-field-severity--low, sp-field-severity--good, sp-field-severity--warning, sp-field-severity--blocked`) to the  `<div />` based on the field's value. This is what determines the element's background color. A class of `ms-fontColor-neutralSecondary` is always applied to ensure the text color is legible in both light and dark themes. Then, it outputs a `<span />` element with an `iconName` attribute. This attribute applies another CSS class to that `<span />` that shows an [Office UI Fabric](https://dev.office.com/fabric#/) icon inside that element. Finally, another `<span />` element is outputted that contains the value inside the field.

Name: text-contains
Title: Text Contains
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates using the indexOf function (O365 only) to test if text contains a given value. The sample also uses the toLowerCase function to ensure the contains condition is case-insensitive. In this sample, if the text of the current field contains the word 'dead' a class is applied to turn the text red.

Name: text-course-registration
Title: Course Registration
Author: Dennis|Chris Kent
Description: Demonstrates creating a button to register for a course.

Name: text-expand-collapse-format
Title: Expand Collapse Format
Author: Andr√© Lage
Description: Demonstrates creating a button to register for a course.

Name: text-isbn-image
Title: Formatting an ISBN (text column) to book cover image. Images are retrieved by calling Open Library Covers API.
Author: Aaron Miao
Description: This example retrieves book cover images based on their ISBN numbers by utilizing the Open Library Covers API. The API works by building a cover image URL with the ISBN.

Name: text-local-image
Title: Demonstrates how to reference a local image
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample provides multiple formats to illustrate the options available to reference local image files. The primary purpose is to demonstrate the usage of `@currentWeb` (O365 only) to prevent issues with reusable formats or formats rendered outside of the main list view.

Name: text-local-link
Title: Demonstrates how to link to a local resource
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample provides multiple formats to illustrate the options available to link to local resources. The primary purpose is to demonstrate the usage of `@currentWeb` (O365 only) to prevent issues with reusable formats or formats rendered outside of the main list view. This format links to other lists, but this could just as easily be specific pages/files/etc. on a site.

Name: text-ryg-status-indicator
Title: Traffic Light (Red-Yellow-Green) Status Indicator
Author: Travis Lingenfelder
Description: This sample displays a traffic light style (Red-Yellow-Green) status indicator based on the value of a choice/text column (to use a lookup column, switch all occurrences of `@currentField` to `@currentField.lookupValue`).

Name: text-startswith-callingcodes
Title: Text StartsWith Calling Codes
Author: Chris Kent
Description: This sample demonstrates using the indexOf function (O365 only) to test if text starts with a given value. Using the international calling code at the start of a phone number, the correct country's flag is shown next to the phone number. The same nested conditionals are also used for the tooltip.

Name: text-strikethrough
Title: Strikethrough on Completion
Author: Chris Kent
Description: Classic task lists add a strikethrough style to the task name when the task is marked as completed. This sample shows how to achieve this in a modern list view.

Name: text-wrap-format
Title: Formatting column with long text to multiple-line with word wrap.
Author: Aaron Miao
Description: With modern document libraries and lists, lengthy multi-line fields no longer show text in full (a fade is provided). This isn't always desired, so this sample demonstrates rending long text to mutilple lines with word wrap, similar to classic mode.

Name: yesno-checkbox
Title: Yes/No Checkbox
Author: Chris Kent|Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample uses Fluent UI icons and theme classes to provide a better visualization for Yes/No fields while respecting theme colors.

Name: yesno-checkmark
Title: Yes/No Column Check Mark
Author: Travis Lingenfelder
Description: This example displays a check mark when the value of a Yes/No column is equal to Yes. This field uses the iconName attribute to display the CheckMark Fluent UI icon.

Name: yesno-checkmark-format
Title: Formatting Yes/No field to check mark based on the value in the field
Author: Aaron Miao
Description: You can apply conditional formatting to Yes/No fields. This sample applies different classes depending on whether the value of the field is Yes (true), No (false), or Blank. This example applies one of the column formatting [predefined classes](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepoint/dev/declarative-customization/column-formatting#predefined-classes) (`sp-field-severity--good`,`sp-field-severity--low`, or `sp-field-severity--blocked`) to the root `<div />` based on the field's value. This is what determines the element's background color. A class of `ms-fontColor-neutralSecondary` is always applied to ensure the text color is legible in both light and dark themes. Then, it outputs a `<span />` element with an `iconName` attribute that shows an [Office UI Fabric](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/fabric#/styles/icons) icon inside that element.

Name: yesno-icon-color
Title: Yes/No Icon Color
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates how to change the color of the icon according to the value of the Yes/No column.

Name: yesno-roundedfill-format
Title: Rounded Fill Checkbox
Author: Andr√© Lage
Description: This sample includes custom checkbox rounded styles.

Name: yesno-toggle-format
Title: Yes/No Column Toggle
Author: Tetsuya Kawahara
Description: This sample demonstrates changing the value of the Yes/No column to a toggle. Three different versions of the sample are provided (Toggle, Icon, Emoji).
